About IHARC

We believe in direct action that creates real, lasting change for the most vulnerable members of our community.

Our Mission

To provide integrated, person-centered support that addresses homelessness, mental health, addictions, and community safety through collaborative, evidence-based approaches.

We are committed to:

  • Treating every person with dignity and respect
  • Removing barriers to accessing essential services
  • Building stronger, safer communities for everyone
  • Using data and evidence to guide our work

Our Integrated Approach

Rather than addressing issues in isolation, we recognize that homelessness, mental health, addiction, and community safety are interconnected challenges that require coordinated solutions.

Person-Centered

Every individual's needs, strengths, and goals guide the support we provide. We meet people where they are.

Trauma-Informed

We understand the widespread impact of trauma and actively work to create safe, supportive environments for healing.

Evidence-Based

Our programs are grounded in research and best practices, continuously evaluated for effectiveness and impact.

Collaborative

We work alongside community partners, government agencies, and residents to address systemic challenges.

Responsive

We adapt quickly to changing community needs and emerging challenges, maintaining flexibility in our approach.

Transparent

We maintain open communication with the community about our work, challenges, and outcomes.

Serving Northumberland County

IHARC proudly serves all communities across Northumberland County, working to ensure no one falls through the cracks.

Our Coverage Area

Cities & Towns

  • Cobourg
  • Port Hope
  • Campbellford
  • Brighton

Townships

  • Hamilton Township
  • Alnwick/Haldimand
  • Cramahe Township
  • Trent Hills
